  • City: STOCKBRIDGE

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 60125
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: TOTE LOADED ONTO TRAILER ALONG WITH OTHER FREIGHT FOR TRANSPORT. FREIGHT SHIFTED AND WAS PUNCTURED BY A FORKLIFT BLADE BEING SHIPPED. THE PUNCTURE WAS APPROXIMATE 3 INCHES WIDE AND 1 INCH THICK. HAZMAT 1 CONTACTED FOR REMEDIATION AS WELL AS EMERGENCY SERVICES INCLUDING EPA.

item.title: Report E-2024070748
item.description:
Report E-2024070748

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-01T15:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-18
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 18, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon jug of corrosive liquid was punctured and released approximately one-half (0.5) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel utilized absorbents and cleaners to remediate the site. All waste was collected and containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for future disposal.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 10 gallons of Standard Performance Topcoat Cat® Yellow released from (1) 10-gallon metal drum due to freight falling on it during transit. The release impacted the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed SDS with the caller who felt comfortable cleaning the spill with the available PPE onsite.

item.title: Report E-2024070647
item.description:
Report E-2024070647

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-29T09:15:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-18
  • City: KENNESAW
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 18, 2024, two (2) 5-liter pails of UN3149 were punctured in transit and released approximately 1-2 gallons of product to the trailer interior and cardboard boxes. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services, Inc. (HES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the trailer and containerized all impacted materials in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024070649
item.description:
Report E-2024070649

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-29T09:15:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-18
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 18, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1987 was crushed in transit and released approximately less than one (<1) ounce of product to the top of the pail. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. The damaged pail of UN1987 denatured alcohol was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum that was labeled appropriately and staged in the terminal's waste holding room.

item.title: Report E-2024070495
item.description:
Report E-2024070495

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-29T09:15:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-11
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 11, 2024, seventy-two (72) 1-gallon jugs of UN1791 were crushed in transit and released approximately sixty (60) gallons of product to the trailer interior, adjacent freight, and pavement beneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services, Inc. (HES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and degreasing agent to remediate the impacted site. The damaged jugs were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums. All impacted materials were contained in three (3) 55-gallon drums.
